message_1: A set A has 50 elements and a set B has 70 elements. What is the maximum number of elements that the intersection of A and B can have?
message_2: The maximum number of elements that the intersection of A and B can have is equal to the number of elements in the smaller set. In this case, set A has 50 elements, which is smaller than set B with 70 elements. Therefore, the maximum number of elements that the intersection of A and B can have is 50.
